title: Stock Futures, Bond Yields Rise After Powell Says Fed Is Ready to Be More Aggressive
sub_head: Yield on 10-year U.S. Treasury note jumps after Fed chairman eyes quicker interest-rate rises if needed
body:
U.S. stock futures gained and government bond yields jumped as investors digested Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell’s more aggressive tone on reining in inflation.
Futures for the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average advanced 0.4% and 0.5%, respectively, on Tuesday. Contracts for the tech-focused Nasdaq-100 rose 0.5%. Major U.S. stock indexes ended lower Monday after Mr. Powell said the Fed was prepared to raise interest rates in half-percentage-point steps if needed to tamp down inflation.
